chapter.title: Common features
chapter.para: This chapter covers those attributes and features that are common to many of the components in the tag libraries.

section.title: Positioning and appearance of components
section.para: A number of attributes relating to positioning and appearance are common to several components.

listitem.para: Specifies whether the component is disabled, which disallows user interaction.
References the id of an element on which to focus after a request is completed on the client side.
The height of the component in pixels.
Specifies the direction in which to display text that does not inherit its writing direction. Valid values are LTR (left-to-right) and RTL (right-to-left).
Specifies Cascading Style Sheet (CSS) styles to apply to the component.
Specifies one or more CSS class names to apply to the component.
The width of the component in pixels.

section.title: Calling available JavaScript methods
section.para: Client-side JavaScript methods can be called using component events. These JavaScript methods are defined using the relevant event attribute for the component tag. Methods are referenced through typical Java syntax within the event attribute, while any parameters for the methods are obtained through the data attribute, and referenced using JSF Expression Language (EL). a simple reference to a JavaScript method with a single parameter.
Refer to or to event descriptions unique to each component for specific usage.
